textContent:
Welcome. Tonight is a night of learning, connection, and community. We will learn more about VARC including a tour of the Viroqua area operation. We will connect with businesses and leaders in the community. And we will build community one conversation at a time. Thank you to VARC for hosting us at the first Business After 5

VARC has a lot to celebrate.
This is VARC’s 50th Anniversary. Strong and steady growth in our early years, coupled by more assertive, planful scaling over the last 10 has led to long-term sustainability and success, serving over 1200 children and adults annually, and growing.

This year VARC won Manufacturer of the Year award from the Wisconsin Chamber. WMC is the arguably the state’s most influential and prestigious business association. This award was awarded exclusively to VARC for their  commitment to excellence in inclusion.

I’m honored to introduce Liz Filter, President and CEO of VARC. born and raised in Viroqua Liz is in her 24th year at VARC, and 6th year as the President/CEO.
title: Welcome
textContentHtml:
Welcome. Tonight is a night of learning, connection, and community. We will learn more about VARC including a tour of the Viroqua area operation. We will connect with businesses and leaders in the community. And we will build community one conversation at a time. Thank you to VARC for hosting us at the first Business After 5


VARC has a lot to celebrate.

This is VARC’s 50th Anniversary. Strong and steady growth in our early years, coupled by more assertive, planful scaling over the last 10 has led to long-term sustainability and success, serving over 1200 children and adults annually, and growing.


This year VARC won Manufacturer of the Year award from the Wisconsin Chamber. WMC is the arguably the state’s most influential and prestigious business association. This award was awarded exclusively to VARC for their  commitment to excellence in inclusion.


I’m honored to introduce Liz Filter, President and CEO of VARC. born and raised in Viroqua Liz is in her 24th year at VARC, and 6th year as the President/CEO.
